benchmark_details.name: LLMEval-Med
benchmark_details.overview: LLMEval-Med is a comprehensive benchmark designed for evaluating the performance of large language models (LLMs) in medical contexts, featuring 2,996 high-quality questions derived from real-world clinical scenarios and electronic health records across five core medical dimensions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic and comprehensive evaluation framework for medical LLMs, ensuring authenticity and practicality in real clinical scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Despite its comprehensive nature, LLMEval-Med primarily focuses on Chinese medical contexts, which may limit generalizability to other healthcare systems and languages.

data.source: Real-world clinical records and expert-designed clinical scenarios.
data.annotation: Curated and reviewed by medical professionals to ensure high-quality assessment criteria.

methodology.calculation: Usability Rate reflects whether the modelâ€™s responses provide genuine medical value.
methodology.interpretation: Responses scoring 4 or above indicate adequate addressing of user inquiries.
methodology.validation: High human-machine agreement rate for usability judgments across tasks.
